intro: Erigeron limnophilus, commonly known as the marsh fleabane, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and pond edges. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, arranged in a cluster that resembles a dandelion. Erigeron limnophilus plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland biodiversity.
